subject: Climate & Environment
title: Pumped Hydro Storage
description: A micro-lesson that makes Pumped Hydro Storage usable.

hook.text: The world's largest battery isn't made of lithium. It is made of water and gravity.

buildup.text: When power is cheap, pumps push water uphill into a reservoir. It waits there.

discovery.text: When demand peaks, the water flows back down through turbines, generating electricity.

twist.text: Pumped hydro accounts for 90% of all grid-scale energy storage worldwide.

climax.text: Some systems use old mines or underground caverns instead of hilltop reservoirs.

punchline.text: Gravity never runs out and never needs a software update.

quiz.question: What share of global grid-scale energy storage is pumped hydro?
